data.title: Lost in poetry translation! – From the woods…
data.meta_description: Posts about Lost in poetry translation! written by Sana Shoukat
data.text:
Words have always been as life to me; such a thing which one adores, relishes and becomes a mad lover of. But the words clothed with the blood of betrayal have stained the gleaming fabric of my belief and have taken my madness to believe in them away. Being called a rose and being trained like a thorn, not anymore! Deciphering life at 2:21 AM with the gentle rain gracing the thirst-stricken boundaries of my house, my inner voice utters; deceiving with words must be their charm but deciphering their words should be yours. Take the plunge and don’t be a prey to words which are not backed up by actions and doings. Be aware the next time you are being called a rose. You know what to do! 😉

The ones who have gone through my previous post ‘Deciphering life…(1)’ must be aware that while deciphering life, I also decipher some favorite Urdu couplets to English translation. The place is again Panjpeer Rocks where not only birds sing but life too. Hope you find the cure through these couplets.

آؤ خوابوں کی باندھ کر آنکھیں

دور جنگل میں چھوڑ آتے ہیں

Let us blindfold our dreams

and leave them in the jungle

دھیان کے آتش دان میں ناصر

بجھے دنوں کا ڈھیر پڑا ہے

A furnace of thoughts, Nasir

Holds the heap of the bygone days

Poet: Nasir Kazmi

وقت کی قید میں زندگی ہے مگر

چند گھڑیاں یہی ہیں جو آزاد ہیں

A prisoner of time this life is

Only a few moments to live by freely

Poet: Fayyaz Hashmi

کون سیکھا ہے صرف باتوں سے

سب کو اک حادثہ ضروری ہے

Who understands life with just pieces of advice

Everyone needs a happenstance themselves

صرف اس شوق میں پوچھی ہیں ہزاروں باتیں

میں تیرا حسن تیرے حسنِ بیاں تک دیکھوں

I have asked a thousand things only to revel in

Your beauty and the magnificence of your speech

Poet: Ahmed Nadeem Qasmi

وقت کی چند ساعتیں ساغر

لوٹ آئیں تو کیا تماشا ہو۔۔۔

If only some moments return to life again, Saghar

What a delightful treachery will they cause

Poet: Saghar Siddiqui

عادتاً تم نے کر دیے وعدے

عادتاً ہم نے اعتبار کیا۔۔۔

Out of sheer habit, you made a promise

And similarly, habitually, I trusted you

Poet: Gulzar

P.S: Only those credits have been given which I am sure of. Please give attribution if you know about the poets and the listed couplets. You can also drop in your favorite verses and couplets.

Deciphering life with words, regrets, love, deceit, prose and poetry. Nature and life are one and the same for me. Like a lover who takes pleasure in writing a love letter to the beloved, I take pleasure in writing a letter to the soul. Nature is my soul.

Like the dewdrops remain with petals, serenity with spring and a silver lining with clouds; nature remains with me as soul with body. While deciphering life, I have tried to blend poetry with nature; the best love letter in the making! These shots have been taken at the place called ‘Panjpeer’ near Kahuta in Rawalpindi district, Pakistan.

Here is a collection of a few favorite pieces of Urdu poetry along with a loose English translation.

رات پھیلی ہے تیرے سرمئی آنچل کی طرح

چاند نکلا ہے تجھے ڈھونڈنے پاگل کی طرح

The night intensifies like your dark apparel

The moon embarks a deep struggle to find you

Poet: Kaleem Usmani

وہ بے وفا ہے تو کیا مت کہو برا اس کو

کہ جو ہوا سو ہوا خوش رکھے خدا اس کو

نظر نہ آئے تو اس کی تلاش میں رہنا

کہیں ملے تو پلٹ کر نہ دیکھنا اس کو

Do not call him callous even if he is a deserter

May he find happiness beside all deception

Be in his quest if he is out of sight but

Be oblivion if ever an encounter occurs

Poet: Naseer Turabi

یہ جو ہم ہیں نہ احساس میں جلتے ہوئے لوگ

ہم زمیں زاد نہ ہوتے تو ستارے ہوتے

Drenched in the fiery feelings, we are

like the stars if not human-like

سفر ختم نہ ہو تو مشکل اور

ختم ہو جائے تو اور مشکل

An expedition coupled with difficulties is terrible

But no expedition is even more terrible

عمر رائیگاں کردی تب یہ بات مانی ہے

موت اور محبت کی ایک ہی کہانی ہے

Being wasteful with life, consequently, I learn

Love and death are synonymous to each other

Poet: Noshi Gilani

بھیگے رستے، ہلکی برفباری ، گہری دُھند

آج کا موسم ، دل کے موسم جیسا ہے

Misty means, beguiled snowfall, abyssal haze

The heart is as heavy as the weather today

P.S: Only those credits have been given which I am sure of. Please give attribution if you know about the poets and the listed couplets. You can also drop in your favorite verses and couplets.
